snippet: Sixty-two multifaith groups urged the Senate to delay a vote, while supporters of the bill pointed to what they called Iran’s insincerity.
abstract: Partisans in debate over Senate bill to escalate anti-nuclear sanctions against Iran escalate their lobbying; critics submit letter signed by 62 multifaith organizations urging Senate to delay vote.
lead_paragraph: Sixty-two multifaith groups urged the Senate to delay a vote, while supporters of the bill pointed to what they called Iran’s insincerity.

headline.main: Lobbying Picks Up Over Bill to Toughen Antinuclear Sanctions Against Iran
headline.print_headline: Lobbying Picks Up Over Bill to Toughen Antinuclear Sanctions Against Iran
